alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta; Lower Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 5:20AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...A WINTRY MIX OF PRECIPITATION EXPECTED ACROSS THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA AND MIDDLE KUSKOKWIM VALLEY THIS WEEKEND... Low pressure over eastern Russia will advance a front across Southwest Alaska Saturday. Precipitation is expected to develop along the coast Saturday morning and move over the interior of the Kuskokwim Delta and Middle Kuskokwim Valley Saturday afternoon and evening. With temperatures in the upper 20s to lower 30s, the precipitation will start off as snow. However, as the front moves inland, a strong southwesterly flow off the Bering Sea will usher in warmer air and allow temperatures to climb in the middle to upper 30s across the Kuskokwim Delta and the lower to middle 30s for the Middle Kuskokwim Valley. Warming temperatures will allow snow to changeover to rain from west to east beginning Saturday afternoon. A brief period of sleet and freezing rain is possible prior to the changeover to rain, especially in sheltered valleys from east of Bethel to Sleetmute, where colder air may remain in place longer. If any sleet or freezing rain does occur, only trace amounts are expected. 2 to 4 inches of snow is expected across the Kuskokwim Delta and 1 to 3 inches for the Middle Kuskokwim Valley prior to the changeover to rain. For the Kuskokwim Delta, rain is expected to linger into Sunday before changing back to snow late Sunday evening as a cold front moves across the region. For the Middle Kuskokwim Valley, mixed rain and snow Sunday morning will transition back to all snow by late Sunday afternoon.
